intro: Pilosella euchaetia subsp. pseudodoelliana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has small, narrow leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its fibrous roots and herbaceous growth habit make it a hardy, perennial species.
